description: Retrieves search metrics data. The data provides a snapshot of how your users interact with your search application and how effective the application is.

parameters.name: IndexId
parameters.description: The identifier of the index to get search metrics data.

parameters.name: Interval
parameters.description: The time interval or time window to get search metrics data. The time interval uses the time zone of your index. You can view data in the following time windows: THIS_WEEK: The current week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the day before the current date. ONE_WEEK_AGO: The previous week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the following Saturday. TWO_WEEKS_AGO: The week before the previous week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the following Saturday. THIS_MONTH: The current month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on the day before the current date. ONE_MONTH_AGO: The previous month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on the last day of the month. TWO_MONTHS_AGO: The month before the previous month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on last day of the month.

parameters.name: MetricType
parameters.description: The metric you want to retrieve. You can specify only one metric per call. For more information about the metrics you can view, see Gaining insights with search analytics.

nested_items.name: SnapShotTimeFilter
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp for the beginning and end of the time window for the search metrics data.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp for the beginning of the time range.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp for the end of the time range.

nested_items.name: SnapshotsDataHeader
nested_items.description: The column headers for the search metrics data.

nested_items.name: SnapshotsData
nested_items.description: The search metrics data. The data returned depends on the metric type you requested.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If the response is truncated, Amazon Kendra returns this token, which you can use in a later request to retrieve the next set of search metrics data.
